marklogic.body: I am 53 years old and was just diagnosed with ADD/ADHD in 2010. I have had sleep issues for most of my life, but attributed it to whatever was going on at the time ie depression, stress, work schedule, or my stimulant meds. I'm up until 3 or 4am then get up around 8 or 9am on what I have going that day. I have what I call "unintentional naps"(dozing without warning for about 15mins.) usually late afternoon or early evening then I am up and extremely energetic. I've tried antihistamines, melatonin, nature sounds, set bedtime routines and nothing seemed to help. By accident I found a solution that seems to help. I was talking to my sister on the phone, and she said that I was jumping around in the conversation so much that it was giving her a Headache trying to follow my conversation. I had been accidentally given a prescription for short Acting Dexadrine when I called my dr.'s office for a refill of my Dexadrine ER. I took a half of a 10 mg tablet and in a little while I seemed to calm down, and actually felt sleepy. I went to bed that night before midnight, had the best night's sleep that I can remember and woke up feeling rested. I thought that I was just weird having that kind of reaction. I will be bringing this up to my doctor next week when I see her. This article backs up my own experience. Now if I could just remember to take it every night.
